column5: å‡  (jÇ)This word is used to ask about the number or quantity of something, and is often translated as "how many" or "how much." It is used to inquire about a small or indefinite number.å°‘ (shÇo)This word means "few" or "little," and is used to describe a small quantity or number. It is used to indicate a scarcity or insufficiency of something.For example, you can use å‡  (jÇ) to ask "How many apples do you want?" or "How much water do you need?" However, you would use å°‘ (shÇo) to say "There are few people in the room" or "There is little time left."
